node.title: Flooding an icebreaker: Australia's daring mission to capture Antarctic krill
node.alt: A handful of penguins and a seal face off on a small piece of ice beside the ocean.
node.description: After returning from Antarctic voyages without a single krill to use for studying climate change, scientists had a daring idea: to flood an icebreaker and bring the krill to them.
node.content:
["Krill are essential to understanding climate change. But Antarctic voyages\u00a0have been unable to catch krill for four years.\u00a0", "So scientists took an untested idea into the south seas in hopes of success.", "Beneath this thick sea ice is one of the world's most unappreciated climate warriors.", "Antarctic krill are a food source for almost every animal on the ice.", "Their home is under threat. The ice that provides protection is melting. Carbon dioxide in the water is killing the young.", "To understand the threat of climate change, scientists need to study live krill in laboratories.\u00a0", "But catching krill is notoriously difficult.", "This summer, Australian expeditioners set out on a 39-day journey to collect samples using a daring and untested\u00a0method.\u00a0", "Australia's new icebreaking vessel, the RSV Nuyina,\u00a0was loaded with portable aquariums.", "It then headed south into\u00a0dangerous waters, with a plan to\u00a0deliberately flood a room in the name of science.", "
The incredible carbon-eating talent of krill
", "The first glimpse of sea ice past\u00a0the Antarctic Circle made\u00a0the importance of the\u00a0mission clear.", "", "
Penguins and a seal jostle for position to hunt for food beneath the water.(ABC News: Henry Belot)
", "Almost every animal living here \u2014\u00a0whales, penguins, seals, fish and seabirds \u2014\u00a0depends on krill for food.", "The crew watched as several\u00a0Adelie\u00a0penguins and a seal jostled for position on a small disc of ice, with krill likely swimming underneath.", "It's here that Antarctic krill are performing a role that heavy industry and governments across the world are investing billions of dollars trying to mimic \u2014\u00a0carbon capture and storage.", "Krill act as a conveyor belt for carbon, carrying it from the water's surface to the deep depths, where it can remain for centuries.", "", "Here's how it happens: first, krill\u00a0eat algae near the surface containing carbon\u00a0from the atmosphere.", "", "Then they swim deep below and deposit the carbon as waste, which sinks to the bottom of the ocean \u2013 a natural form of carbon capture\u00a0and storage.", "", "Whales, penguins, seals and fish eat the krill, absorbing\u00a0more carbon into their own bodies.", "", "When those predators die and sink to the bottom of the ocean, they are consumed by deep-sea creatures.", "Other animals can perform this task, but none to the scale of krill\u00a0\u2014 the most abundant animal on Earth.", "Estimates of how much carbon is taken deep by Antarctic krill vary greatly, but some studies suggest it could be around 39 million tonnes per year.", "Dr Anna Belcher, an ecological biogeochemist at the British Antarctic Survey, said krill provide a \"highway for the transport of carbon deeper in the ocean\".", "\"The deeper in the ocean the sinking faecal pellets get, the longer the carbon they contain is locked away from the atmosphere.\"", "If the krill population was to decline, carbon levels in the water could increase.", "", "
Penguins hover on an enormous iceberg, which they will use as a launching pad to hunt.(ABC News: Henry Belot)
", "
The frontier\u00a0of climate change
", "Antarctica offers a chance to watch climate change unfold\u00a0before your eyes.", "If you wait long enough in front of a glacier, you will\u00a0see sheets of ice from the cliff face collapse into the ocean \u2014\u00a0another few drops added to rising sea levels.\u00a0", "", "
Small chunks of ice that have broken from an Antarctic glacier foam in the freezing waters.(ABC News: Henry Belot)
", "As waters warm, the amount of frozen ocean is shrinking. In East Antarctica, sea ice has remained relatively stable. But it's receding faster towards the west.\u00a0", "A 2016 study warned krill habitat could shrink by as much as 80 per cent by 2100.", "\"We have seen the krill populations move southwards over the last 90 years,\" Dr Belcher said.", "And there is another predator: trawling vessels, whose commercial opportunities to fish for valuable krill oil are growing as the sea ice cover recedes.", "Australian marine biologist Rob King, who has spent his life studying the fragile creatures, said if krill disappeared, it would spell disaster for the entire food chain.", "", "
Almost 90 per cent of a crabeater seal's diet is Antarctic krill. Their\u00a0teeth have evolved to strain krill from the water.(ABC News: Henry Belot)
", "", "
Adelie penguins are curious and awkward on land but incredible swimmers, diving to depths of 175 metres in search of\u00a0krill.(ABC News: Henry Belot)
", "", "
Whales migrate from tropical waters to feast on huge krill swarms during summer months.(ABC News: Henry Belot)
", "\"If the krill population declined in the Southern Ocean, we'd see the big charismatic megafauna that we all associate with this region starting to suffer,\" Mr King said.\u00a0", "\"Things like the blue whales and fin whales, that are going through a recovery since the end of whaling, would really feel the effects of declining krill.\"", "What scientists need to find out is the tipping point in\u00a0carbon dioxide levels that could trigger a population collapse.", "The Nuyina's voyage south is 15 years in the making\u00a0and informed by decades of trial and error collecting perfect krill samples.", "Despite their abundance, catching krill isn't easy.", "Earlier expeditions relied on heavy trawl nets that could be ruined by ice, were difficult to deploy\u00a0and could damage the krill.", "Scientists with competing research projects get limited time on board\u00a0\u2014 and it's bad luck if there's no krill around during the allotted time.", "", "
Marine biologist Rob King: \"Every time you go to Antarctica you see something different.\"(ABC News: Henry Belot)
", "It's been four years since Australian scientists had fresh krill to study, and it's beginning to compromise their research.", "Rob King still remembers returning to Hobart after an Antarctic voyage without a single krill to study in the aquarium.\u00a0", "\"I think it was just a lot of time spent on decks of ships wishing you could sample for krill when you couldn't,\" Mr King said.\u00a0", "\"When you are in sea ice you just can't put [fishing] gear in the water when the ship is moving or it will be destroyed.\"", "Out of that frustration, Mr King pitched\u00a0an alternative that would make most shipbuilders anxious.", "His plan:\u00a0suck the krill inside by drilling holes into the ship to flood it with icy Antarctic waters.", "", "
The Nuyina icebreaker has three holes drilled into its side to capture Antarctic krill for scientific study.(ABC News: Emma Machan)
", "\"The\u00a0thing about adding a hole into a ship is that if you try and do it to an existing ship, there is an enormous back pressure from the people who want the ship to stay afloat!\" Mr King said.\u00a0", "\"But if you do it at the very start of a ship's genesis \u2014\u00a0so that it can go through all of classification and have it built into the ship \u2014\u00a0that makes it possible.\"", "The Nuyina is unusual in that three holes have been deliberately drilled in the hull to allow freezing waters to flood a small room below sea level.\u00a0", "The theory is that Antarctic krill could be sucked inside the ship, where they would spill onto a filter table.", "The water would push the animals into a well, where they could be scooped into buckets and taken to aquariums.", "The \"wet well\"\u00a0is adjacent to the engine hall\u00a0and there is an obvious risk involved.", "If something went wrong, the air-tight door into the flooded\u00a0room must remain sealed. Scientists needing an escape could\u00a0climb a ladder out of\u00a0the room and then close the latch.", "Despite more than a decade of planning, expeditioners on this voyage had no idea whether it would actually work.", "Understandably, there were some nerves.\u00a0", "The first test began\u00a0around 2am, when krill usually rise to the surface to feed on phytoplankton.\u00a0", "More than 8,000 Antarctic krill were caught\u00a0during the ship's first voyage \u2014\u00a0the biggest catch in years.\u00a0", "\"That is what I always dreamed it could deliver, but you don't expect to just turn it on and have it like that,\" Mr King said.", "\"It's the best way to wake up in the morning, to go 200 metres from your cabin down to somewhere you can flick a switch and have live Antarctic krill delivered to you instantly.\"", "As aquarist Anton Rocconi monitors the health of the Antarctic krill now floating in chilled aquariums, he marvels at a breakthrough that provides \"survival rates that you just don't see in a trawl\".", "", "
Aquarist Anton Rocconi: \"This first adventure down south has been incredible. The scenery, unsurprisingly, is incredible.\"(Pete Harmsen)
", "", "
Antarctic krill are masters of carbon capture and storage, removing the equivalent in emissions of\u00a035,000 cars from the ocean\u2019s surface each year.(Pete Harmsen)
", "Mr Rocconi said with so many samples in perfect condition, scientists would be able to run experiments with different temperatures and carbon dioxide levels to truly understand what impact climate change is having.", "\"Many times, scientists can go to the Antarctic and not be able to catch what they need, so this really improves the chances and really will change the way we do our research,\" Mr King said.", "
Returning home
", "One of the riskiest parts of the voyage still remains:\u00a0getting the temperature-sensitive krill off the ship and safely into\u00a0Hobart aquariums.", "As the ship slowly approaches land, a wandering albatross escorts the crew and cargo.\u00a0", "There are only 10,000 adult pairs of these birds left in the wild.", "Its presence is a reminder of what's at stake as preparations are made for the krill aquariums to be lifted off the ship by cranes and onto the back of trucks waiting at port.\u00a0", "", "
The wandering albatross population is slowly recovering after being decimated by long-line hooks used by the commercial fishing industry.(ABC News: Henry Belot)
", "The refrigerated containers must be switched off before being lifted. That means there's a race against time to get the krill into aquariums before the water temperature exceeds 3.5C\u00a0in the late January heat.", "Like penguins scrambling for food on the ice, the scientists jostle for their krill to be offloaded before crew and cargo.", "There is no time to wait for their bags to be unloaded:\u00a0the scientists race from the port in the truck.", "Just days ago, one of the scientists sent a message from a Hobart\u00a0lab to say some of the Antarctic krill had just bred in captivity.", "\"It is so relieving and inspiring to know that all of our hard work over the voyage has delivered.\"", "The ABC travelled to Antarctica with the support of the Australian Antarctic Program.", "
Credits
", "Reporter: Henry Belot", "Photography: Henry Belot,\u00a0Pete Harmsen", "Illustrations: Emma Machan", "Production &\u00a0editing: Jake Evans"]
